summary: This bill, the Entrepreneurs with Disabilities Reporting Act of 2025, mandates that the Administrator of the Small Business Administration (SBA) submit a report to Congress within 180 days of its enactment. The report must detail the challenges faced by entrepreneurs with disabilities when starting and running businesses. It will include assessments, descriptions of SBA resources and outreach, joint efforts with other agencies, identification of resource deficiencies, analyses of resource utilization, and recommendations for legislative action. The bill specifies no additional appropriations.
